result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan R Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $50 per month commencing 01-04-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 10 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan R Colon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  
Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Sworn in.

State moves to amend the felony to a misdemeanor.
Amended Information filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $694.00
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 01/04/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in  full.
Alternate:  10  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 09:00 am

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 10-05-2015 09:00 am

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  
Defendant is engaged in treatment.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Dawn Maldonado appearing.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 30, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Second
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
Hearing on June 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenson, interpreter. Atty. Rosario requests to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.  Court allows Public Defender to appoint another attorney.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants the request. Matter to be scheduled for status hearing only. INTERPRETER WILL BE NEEDED.  Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sarah Tapia appearing as interpreter.  Atty. Rosario requests and adjournment of preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Vicki Bermundez, interpreter. Defendant went to the Public Defender's Office and there was to be an attorney here. Atty. Rosario was appointed. Court sets preliminary hearing within 20 days.   Bail remains as fixed. Clerk to notice Atty. Rosario of the next date and time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not wish to have counsel. Defendant is unsure as to what he wants to do. Court advised him to go to the public defender's office. Time limits are tolled for the preliminary. Court is requesting that a interpreter appear at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with any co-actors listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
